Posts.Content: I started same time as Jojo (10th may) 3 x FEC 3 x T.  As she said..each day at a time. Energy levels all time low. Worse time was days 3 and 4 after chemo when I just curled up in a corner really, night sweats, hot flushes and cold sweats. Started feeling better during Monday (day 5) not great, but better. So Lee, chin up, we'll all get through it. Love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Due to start chemo 24th May

Posts.Content: Well done Jojo, I feel more human today, but don't think I've got the energy to flit around on trains. Love to all of us xxx
Posts.Title: Due to start chemo 24th May

Posts.Content: I shaved mine off, I now look like a wrinklier version of my son lol, for me it's chemo no 4 on the 12th, love and hugs xxx
Posts.Title: I've done it! Shaved my head today...

Posts.Content: Hi Fran, mine is second time around as well. I had mascectomy in 2002. Now had a cancerous lump in armpit same side, and two tumours between implant and skin, had implant out and rest of lymph nodes out, 11 out of 17 cancerous cells, I'm having 6 sessions of FEC-T. had 3rd round last wed, now it's docetaxol for the next 3. Then radiotherapy then meds. As like you I've been told it hasn't spread anywhere else. How far have you got with your treatment at the moment? Keep strong xxx
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer 2nd time around

Posts.Content: Hi, I've got a PICC line, the hospital and district nurse always replace the tubigrip when the dressings changed. They also wrap gauge round the end port. I like the idea of the patterned tights. I've got some that never get worn, I'll have to dig them out tomorrow. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: PICC line - advice please

Posts.Content: Hi missavis, feel for you, I had breast cancer in 2002, mascectomy and implant, i got primary cancer in lymph nodes and two tumours between implant and skin on same side this year, goodbye lymph nodes and implant. Going through chemo at mo, be positive as much as you can, we can all get through this, it may be tough but we can do it, it's so sad about your mum ❤️. I come on here most days, I'm sure it helps to know we're not on our own, love and hugs, Jan xxx
Posts.Title: Hi I am so so sad today my breast cancer is back

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm having my 2nd chemo next Wednesday 31st. Two days ago I woke up and couldn't touch my head, it was so tender, since then my hair has been coming out, could make a nice bristle paintbrush with it if I save it up lol. Today's hair loss worse than yesterday, just wondering if it's going to be on the pillow in the morning instead of my head. I was so prepared for it, wig got, hats got, but now it's actually happening I'm not so confident. Went shopping today, just hoping none of it dropped in anyone else's trolley After waffling on, I'm sorry I can't answer your question as to how long it goes on for, cos I'm only a couple of days ahead of you, but I can sympathise with you. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Scalp pain and impending hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Jane, i was only told not to take my cods, evening primrose and multi vits only when I was going for pre assessment for chemo, I'd already had my surgery about a month before that, no one mentioned vits at pre op. Wish you all the best for your surgery. I'm about to have second dose of chemo this wed coming FEC-T. Really looking forward to it....not lol. Still, has to be done. Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Diagnosed and scared.

Posts.Content: Hi, I agree with all the replies to your post, I finished radio end of October. On Letrozole for next 5 years. I got discharged from oncology onto Open Access. The nurse there did say, basically, after approx a year having surgery,chemo and radio, it takes about 18 months to 2 years to get back to “normal”. So ladies, I think we’ve just got to be patient, although it’s so annoying feeling ugh most of the time. Love and hugs to all of you xxx
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi princesa8,  I had 17 cancerous lymph nodes out of 21 remaining nodes removed, others were removed 15 yrs ago. I've had chemo and on my last week of radiotherapy, I was told that it hadn't spread to any organs, so be positive, there are loads of us that have had dodgy nodes Xxx
Posts.Title: Worry over positive lymph nodes
